intro: Hieracium obscuratum, commonly known as the dark hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, appearing in clusters at the top of the stem, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium obscuratum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
